articles.title: DPRK Vice-Premier Meets Delegation of Int'l Planned Parenthood Federation
articles.content:
DPRK Vice-Premier Meets Delegation of Int'l Planned Parenthood Federation
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, met and had a talk with a delegation of the International Planned Parenthood Federation led by Director-general Tewodros Melesse which paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Chairwoman of Federation Council of Russia
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Chairwoman of Federation Council of Russia
						
 Moscow, June 23 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on a visit to Russia, had a talk with Valentina Ivanovna Matvienko, chairwoman of the Russian Federation Council, on Tuesday.
					 Valentina Ivanovna Matvienko referred to the great attention paid by Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of Korean people, to the development of traditional Russia-DPRK friendship.
					
					 She said Russia has kept friendly feelings toward neighboring country DPRK and the Russian leadership remains unchanged in its will to develop the bilateral relations onto a higher level.
					
					 All the issues concerning the Korean peninsula should be settled peacefully without fail, he noted, adding Russia would express invariable support for the DPRK at the international arenas including UN.
					
					 Sending warm congratulations on the 70th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea this year, she sincerely hoped for the further success in the DPRK people's efforts for economic construction and improvement of people's livelihood.
					
					 Present there were Choe's party and Kim Hyong Jun, DPRK ambassador to Russia, and Ilyas Umahanov, vice-chairman of the Federation Council, and others concerned.

articles.title: Talks Held between Speakers of DPRK SPA and Russian State Duma
articles.content:
Talks Held between Speakers of DPRK SPA and Russian State Duma
						
 Moscow, June 23 (KCNA) -- There took place talks between Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly (SPA), and Sergei Narishkin, speaker of the Russian State Duma, at the building of the State Duma on Tuesday.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were the chairman's party and Kim Hyong Jun, DPRK ambassador to Russia, and from the Russian side were Ivan Melinikov, first deputy speaker of the State Duma, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Both sides exchanged views on the issue on further developing friendship and cooperation between the assemblies of the two countries and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Talks between FMs of DPRK and Equatorial Guinea Held
articles.content:
Talks between FMs of DPRK and Equatorial Guinea Held
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- There took place talks between Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, head of a DPRK government delegation on a visit to the Republic of Equatorial Guinea, and Agapito Mba Mokuy, minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of Equatorial Guinea, on Monday.
					 Discussed at the talks were the issues on boosting the bilateral relations in diverse fields.
					
					 The DPRK government delegation was invited to a reception hosted by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of Equatorial Guinea.

articles.title: Deplorable State of S. Korean Workers Disclosed
articles.content:
Deplorable State of S. Korean Workers Disclosed
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The National Reunification Institute issued a white paper Wednesday disclosing the miserable state of south Korean workers attributable to the puppet forces' unpopular rule.
					 The number of the unemployed has shown an exponential increase in recent years, becoming a serious social problem, the white paper said, and went on:
					
					 The number was over 3.5 million in 2013 which rose to at least 4.5 million in 2014 and more than 500 000 of them gave up employment. And the number of underemployed increased to 10 million from 8 million in the period.
					
					 What is all the more serious is the problem of jobless young people.
					
					 Earlier this year the rate of young people without job was 21.8 percent, an increase from the time of massive unemployment that was caused by group bankruptcy after 1997 currency run. The rate was estimated to be higher than the average unemployment rate among the member nations of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development and regions.
					
					 University graduates without jobs showed a record high of 2.75 million. 
					
					 The severity of youth unemployment in south Korea can be seen in the fact that youth are giving up love, marriage and childbirth plus housing and getting relations with people.
					
					 This notwithstanding, the present chief executive is enticing young people into going abroad, saying they can get jobs only when they go abroad.
					
					 But young south Koreans only meet national humiliation and contempt and miserable death.
					
					The proportion of part-time workers under less than a year contract has reached 37.1 %, the highest among major capitalist countries and in the region.
					
					 What is all the more deplorable is the pervasive "status system" which says children with part-time worker parents have to be part-timers.
					
					 The white paper revealed the fact that south Korean workers are doing labor under extremely poor working conditions.
					
					 According to data underreported by the south Korean relevant authorities, the number of victims of industrial disaster was over 90 900 or more than 240 on a daily average across south Korea last year and among them the number of those who suffered from accidents were more than 83 200 and victims of occupational disease by harmful materials were over 7 600.
					
					 The mortality rate due to industrial disaster topped the world list being 2 or 4 times higher than that in major capitalist countries.
					
					 CNN in an article introducing south Korea in August last year said weekly work hours of workers in south Korea is 12 hours longer than an average work hours of people in other parts of the world, adding daily sleeping hours of south Korean workers are less than six hours.
					
					 Yet, they fail to get even the minimum wages for doing hard work.
					
					 In south Korea where the jungle law prevails, employment crime whereby the rights of workers are mercilessly violated is ubiquitous.
					
					 What is all the more serious is that teenagers, the disabled and women are taken as "labor force easy to be hired with meager wage".
					
					 Child labor is internationally banned but teenagers are subject to harsh forced labor in south Korea today.
					
					 74.2 percent of teenagers working in the service fields in Seoul are doing slave labor without contract. Exploitation of the disabled is making people tremble with horror as it is beyond human imagination.
					
					 According to a report released by the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, the rate of women taking part in economic activities and their employment rate, ages 25 to 54, are 62.8 percent and 61.2 percent each, the lowest among the member countries and in the region.
					
					 What is all the more problematic is the serious sexual violence committed against women workers at work sites.
					
					 In March this year the British magazine Economist ridiculed at the worst discrimination against south Korean women in the world.
					
					 A broad segment of the toiling masses of south Korea are protesting against the present authorities' unpopular labor policy that benefits the big businesses.
					
					 More than 20 workers committed suicide unable to stand suppression of trade unions and lay-off after the present regime took office.
					
					 Workers are staging sit-ins, risking their lives.
					
					 Getting all the more fierce is protest of workers against the unpopular rule by the authorities keen on intensifying suppression.
					
					 All facts go to clearly prove that south Korea is the world's worst tundra of human rights and a dark society where democracy and human rights can not be found.
					
					 However, the present south Korean ruling quarters slander the most advantageous labor system in the DPRK where genuine popular policies are enforced and speak ill of those who are working abroad with an intention to be helpful to the system. This is a ridiculous provocative act.
					
					 The puppet forces should clearly understand that their anti-DPRK "human rights" racket in collusion with outsiders will precipitate their destruction.

articles.title: Greetings to Mozambique Liberation Front Party
articles.content:
Greetings to Mozambique Liberation Front Party
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea Wednesday sent a message of greeting to the Central Committee of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party and all its members on the 53rd anniversary of its foundation.
					 The message wished the Mozambique Liberation Front Party bigger success in its activities to strengthen the party and achieve national unity and prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties would continue to develop on good terms in the future, too.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Russian, Qatari Personages
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Un from Russian, Qatari Personages
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with gifts by the general manager of the Sheko Co. Ltd. in Russia and the general manager of the Signature Construction Corporation in Qatar on the occasion of the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The gifts were conveyed to officials concerned of the DPRK working in the above-said countries by P. A. Erdzanikovich, general manager of the Russian company, and Mazin Abdulfatah Salem Sayala, general manager of the Qatari corporation, on June 8 and 18.

articles.title: Visiting Group of Lenin Young Communist League Arrives in Rason
articles.content:
Visiting Group of Lenin Young Communist League Arrives in Rason
						
 Rason, June 24 (KCNA) -- A group of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation led by Yevgeni Lashenko, first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the league, arrived in Rason Wednesday to tour the area of Mt. Paektu.

articles.title: Delegation of French Business People Here
articles.content:
Delegation of French Business People Here
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of French business people led by Alban Yung, Chinese representative of the "Foundation of Victor Segalen" in France, arrived here Wednesday.

articles.title: European External Action Service Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
European External Action Service Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the European External Action Service headed by Gerhard Sabathil, director for Northeast Asia and Pacific, left here Wednesday.

articles.title: Workers and Trade Unions Members Vow to Take Revenge upon U.S. Imperialists
articles.content:
Workers and Trade Unions Members Vow to Take Revenge upon U.S. Imperialists
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A meeting of workers and members of the trade unions took place in the Compound of the National House of Class Education on Wednesday to vow to take revenge upon the U.S. imperialists with the approach of June 25, the day of struggle against U.S. imperialism.
					 Choe Su Dong, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, read out a statement of indignation.
					
					 He said that the war launched by the U.S. imperialists in the 1950s was a war of aggression prompted by their wild ambition to turn the whole of Korea into their colony and dominate the world and the most bestial war of genocide unprecedented in the human history of war.
					
					 He denounced the U.S. imperialists for brutally killing innocent people at random irrespective of age and sex everywhere they went and reducing the northern half of Korea into ashes through indiscriminate bombing and shelling.
					
					 He expressed indignation at the U.S. imperialists for making no scruple of using germ and chemical weapons during the Korean war in wanton violation of international law and working out a terrible scenario to fall even A-bombs.
					
					 Speakers stressed that they would win victory on all fronts for building a thriving nation, holding a rifle in one hand and a hammer in the other.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers Vow to Take Revenge upon U.S. Aggressors
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers Vow to Take Revenge upon U.S. Aggressors
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A meeting of agricultural workers took place in the Compound of the Susan-ri House of Class Education in Kangso District on Wednesday to vow to take revenge upon the U.S. aggressors with the approach of June 25, the day of struggle against U.S. imperialism. 
					 Present at the meeting were officials of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea, officials concerned and agricultural workers in the district.
					
					 A reporter and speakers said that the Korean war ignited by the U.S. imperialists was the most impudent and bragandish war for nipping the young DPRK in the bud and turning the whole of Korea into the permanent colony of the U.S. and a genocide unprecedented in history.
					
					 They disclosed the massacres committed by the enemies in Susan-ri and Sinchon County, saying that the U.S. imperialists committed massacres wherever their feet set.
					
					 They stressed that if the U.S. imperialists reignite a war, oblivious of the lessons of history, the army and people of the DPRK will wipe out the enemies by mobilizing their inexhaustible military potentials and thus give vent to the pent-up grudge of the nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Election System Is Most Popular: Scholar
articles.content:
DPRK's Election System Is Most Popular: Scholar
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Elections for deputies to provincial (municipality), city (district) and county people's assemblies are scheduled to take place in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea on July 19.
					 Election committees at all levels were already organized and have launched their work.
					
					 In this regard, Dr. Ri Kyong Chol, section chief of the Academy of Social Sciences, told KCNA:
					
					  The election system in the DPRK is most popular and democratic.
					
					 Its superiority is manifested, above all, in the fact that the system ensures the politico-ideological cohesion of the state and society and consequently all of the eligible voters take active part in elections.
					
					 Its advantages also find itself in the fact that every citizen is allowed to take part in elections on an equal footing.
					
					 In the country citizens aged over 17 can vote or be voted, irrespective of sex, nationality, job, property, standards of education, political view and religious belief. Elections are held through a universal, equal and direct suffrage by secret ballot and those voters, unable to go to polling stations for sickness or old age, are allowed to cast their ballots into mobile boxes.
					
					 And the election system's superiority is expressed in the fact that those devotedly working for the interests of the popular masses are elected for deputies to the organs of state power at all levels.
					
					 Through the forthcoming elections, the DPRK people will show again the might of their unbreakable unity around the supreme leader and the invincibility of Korean-style socialism.

articles.title: Symposium on Reproductive Health Held
articles.content:
Symposium on Reproductive Health Held 
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- There took place a symposium on reproductive health at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Wednesday.
					 Present there were Kim Hyong Hun, vice-minister of Public Health, Kim Song Hui, president of the Korean Family Planning and Maternal and Child Health Association (KFP&MCHA), officials concerned and members of a delegation of the International Planned Parenthood Federation led by Director-general Tewodros Melesse, a mission of international body here and a delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies working in the DPRK.
					
					 The speakers at the symposium referred to the problems arising in the work to improve the reproductive health of the people and the importance of information and other services.
					
					 They swapped the successes and experience gained in the past and expressed hope for boosting cooperation and solidarity in the work to promote reproductive health.
					
					 Speeches were made under the titles "On reproductive health in the DPRK" and "Aging of population and reproductive health".
					
					 The participants enjoyed an art performance given by Korean schoolchildren and looked round photos showing the advantageous health care system under socialism and activities of KFP&MCHA.

articles.title: Various Type U.S. Made Explosives Discovered
articles.content:
Various Type U.S. Made Explosives Discovered
 Hamhung, June 24 (KCNA) -- More U.S. made explosives are being discovered in different places of the  DPRK to bear witness to the aggressive nature and barbarous atrocities of the U.S. imperialists.
					 Lots of U.S.-made explosives have been unearthed and defused in North Hamgyong Province this year. 
					
					 A 500-kg mine was brought to the surface of sea water by a fishing net in the waters off Sinpho City in January. 150-kg bombs were discovered at the construction sites of the vegetable greenhouses in Sinsong-ri, Hamju County and Sapho District, Hamhung City in April.
					
					 Dozens of kg bombs were discovered in Kowon County and Hamju County.
					
					More than 110 bullets, shells, mines and grenades were defused in Hamhung City in May.
					
					 The explosives which bear witness to the cruel and ferocious nature of the enemies go to prove once again that no one should harbor any illusion about the U.S. imperialists but mercilessly wipe out them.

articles.title: DPRK Pay Efforts to Barley Cultivation
articles.content:
DPRK Pay Efforts to Barley Cultivation
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is directing big efforts to the cultivation of barley.
					 Koreans have a long history of barley cultivation.
					
					 According to historical documents, it had been cultivated as a principal crop with rice from long ago. They used barley for sugar and in procession of various dishes and making of traditional Koryo medicines.
					
					 In recent years the DPRK people have striven to produce good strains of barley while extending the sphere of its utilization.
					
					 A high-yield strain of barley was reared in the People's Army and the Ryanggang Provincial Branch of the Academy of Agricultural Science produced short barley seed suited to the climate conditions of the province.

articles.title: Sci-Tech Achievements Encourage Poultry Farming in DPRK
articles.content:
Sci-Tech Achievements Encourage Poultry Farming in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Many sci-tech successes have been achieved in the poultry farming of the DPRK.
					  Among them is a new type of feed-processing line manufactured by the Sariwon Chicken Farm. It has proved very effective as all the processes from grinding and mixing to granulating are automatically controlled.
					
					 The Sinuiju Chicken Farm increases egg production seven times as much as that several years ago, while reducing the consumption of grain fodder 15 percent and addictives 60 percent by introducing different microbial ferments and rare-earth elements in feed production. And the farm put its hatching process on a more scientific basis.
					
					 The same is true of the Tudan and Kwangpho duck farms, which raised the proportion of substitute materials in feed production.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Actions Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Actions Called for in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The April 16 Solidarity of south Korea held a candlelight rally at the Kwanghwamun Plaza of Seoul on June 20 at which it called for actions against the conservative group's suppression.
					 Speakers accused the "government" of hurling police into an operation to search an office room of the organization consisting of bereaved families and civic organizations after labeling the memorial service held in last April for the victims of the ferry Sewol disaster an illegal one.
					
					 They said they would launch actions of all forms to put an end to the authorities' suppression, salvage the ferry and probe the truth about the disaster.
					
					 They declared they would hold a huge rally condemning the authorities' clampdown on June 27.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Party Building Praised by Personages of Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Party Building Praised by Personages of Different Countries
						
  Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Events took place in foreign countries on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					  A seminar on Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Brilliantly Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche, Holding Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as the Eternal General Secretary of Our Party" took place in Austria, meeting in Guinea and lecture in Bangladesh on June 15 and 16.
					
					  On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chief of the Youth Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in Austria and other speakers said that the WPK has grown stronger as an organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people and a mother party since Kim Jong Il started his work at the WPK Central Committee.
					
					  The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea said that Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into the party of Kim Il Sung, its founder, and Kim Jong Il's exploits in party building would shine forever.
					
					 The chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea said that the unique Songun politics and theory formulated by Kim Jong Il serve as an ever-victorious treasured sword for protecting the dignity of countries and nations and achieving the independence of the popular masses.

articles.title: WPK's Important Day Observed Abroad
articles.content:
WPK's Important Day Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Organizations and institutions in different countries and an international organization posted special write-ups on their websites between June 9 and 12 on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The Brazilian Center for the Study of the Juche Idea posted on its website an article titled "Comrade Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the WPK" illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Anti-Imperialist Front of France and a Pakistani study center edited articles praising President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for founding and strengthening the WPK.
					
					 The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted on its website articles titled "Kim Jong Il, eternal general secretary of the WPK", "Kim Jong Il and his immortal exploits performed in party-building" and "Eternal sun of Songun" illustrated with photos dealing with his revolutionary activities.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Brazil
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Brazil
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- A Brazilian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea was formed in Sao Paulo City on June 18.
					 Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee set the celebration period from June 19 to October 15 and decided to widely introduce on publications works of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and their greatness and hold diverse political and cultural events including seminar, photo exhibition and film show in the period.

articles.title: Kuwaiti Paper on Kim Jong Un's Will and Faith in Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Kuwaiti Paper on Kim Jong Un's Will and Faith in Korea's Reunification
						
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- The Kuwaiti paper Al-Anba on June 15 carried an article titled "For paving a wide avenue to independent reunification of Korea" accompanied with a photo of supreme leader Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The paper said:
					
					 It is nearly seven decades since the Korean nation was divided by foreign forces but it is still undergoing sufferings resulting from the division and this makes the world progressives painful.
					
					 The tragedy of the Korean people should neither be tolerated nor allowed to go on.
					
					 Last year the DPRK set forth crucial proposals for improving the inter-Korean relations and achieving national reunification and made every sincere effort to realize them.
					
					 But these proposals have not yielded desired results due to the obstructions of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad and the inter-Korean relations got worse.
					
					 Though the situation is complex and obstacles and difficulties lie in the way of reunification, Kim Jong Un remains steadfast in his faith and will to achieve the national reunification, the lifetime wishes of the preceding leaders and the supreme desire of the nation.
					
					 All Koreans are firmly convinced that a new era of independent reunification would be surely ushered in under his wise leadership.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Observed by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, June 24 (KCNA) -- Iranian, Syrian and Canadian papers carried articles to mark the 15th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The Iranian paper Iran News on June 16 in an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il's exploits for national reunification" said that he dedicated his all to the reunification of Korea.
					
					 The Syrian paper Al Baath on June 14 carried an article titled "On the day when a landmark was provided for the reunification of Korea divided by foreign forces."
					
					 The article noted that the idea of By Our Nation Itself serves as the most just and aboveboard idea which makes it possible to rejoin the severed blood ties of the nation and guidelines indicating the road of putting an end to the outsiders' occupation and achieving independent development under the present situation on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Referring to the achievements made in the drive for reconciliation, cooperation and reunification between the north and the south after the publication of the joint declaration, the article stressed that Korea would be surely reunified in the idea of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 The Canadian paper TML Weekly on June 13 said that the Korean people would make positive efforts to achieve the reunification of the country under the uplifted banner of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration despite all challenges.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok se reune con presidenta del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok se reune con presidenta del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia
						
Moscu, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, de visita en Rusia, se reunio el dia 23 con la presidenta del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia, Valentina Matvienko.
					En la ocasion Valentina dijo que el Maximo Dirigente del pueblo coreano, Kim Jong Un, presta gran atencion al desarrollo de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises.
					
					Subrayo que Rusia tiene el sentimiento amistoso sobre Corea, pais vecino, y anadio que es invariable la voluntad de la direccion rusa de desarrollar en alto nivel las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					Prosiguio que todos los problemas en la Peninsula Coreana deben ser solucionados sin falta por via pacifica y destaco que Rusia expresara siempre el apoyo a Corea en la ONU y otras escenas internacionales.
					
					Felicito el 70o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y deseo de todo corazon al pueblo coreano mayores exitos en su lucha por la construccion economica y la mejora de la vida de la poblacion.
					
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el presidente de la APS y su comitiva, el embajador coreano en Rusia, Kim Hyong Jun, el vicepresidente del Consejo de la FR, Ilyas Umahanov, y otros funcionarios rusos.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre Choe Thae Bok y Serguei Narishkin
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre Choe Thae Bok y Serguei Narishkin
Moscu, 23 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 23 en el edificio de la Duma Estatal de Rusia las conversaciones entre el presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, y el titular de la Duma Estatal de Rusia, Serguei Narishkin.
					En las platicas estuvieron presentes, por la parte coreana, el presidente de la APS y su comitiva y el embajador coreano en Rusia y, por la rusa, el primer vicepresidente de la Duma, Ivan Melinikov, y otros funcionarios.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los parlamentos de los dos paises y otros de interes mutuo.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre canciller coreano y su homologo de Guinea Ecuatorial
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre canciller coreano y su homologo de Guinea Ecuatorial
Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 22 las conversaciones entre el canciller coreano Ri Su Yong quien preside la delegacion gubernamental de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, de visita en la Republica de Guinea Ecuatorial, y el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y Cooperacion de este pais africano, Agapito Mba Mokuy.
					En la ocasion ambas partes discutieron los asuntos para ampliar y desarrollar en varias esferas las relaciones bilaterales.
					
					El mismo dia, la delegacion coreana fue invitada al banquete ofrecido por el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores y Cooperacion de Guinea Ecuatorial.

articles.title: Portavoz de cancilleria de RPDC denuncia instalacion de "oficina de DDHH"
articles.content:
Portavoz de cancilleria de RPDC denuncia instalacion de "oficina de DDHH"
						
Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 23 la siguiente declaracion:
					Se desarrollan en la etapa mas imprudente y provocativa las tentativas de las fuerzas hostiles de difamar la dignidad y el aspecto de la RPDC con el inexistente "problema de DDHH" y aplastar a toda costa la ideologia y regimen de esta.
					
					Pese a las reiteradas advertencias de la RPDC y la fuerte oposicion de varios paises y pueblos del mundo, las fuerzas hostiles instalaron por fin en el suelo surcoreano un organo fantasmal llamado "oficina de DDHH de la ONU".
					
					Tal hecho deviene una provocacion politica desafiante a la dignidad y regimen de la RPDC y un acto criminal que agrava mas la tension de la Peninsula Coreana y la region e inculca la confrontacion so pretexto de la "defensa de derechos humanos".
					
					Las fuerzas hostiles anuncian que segun la "resolucion" del Consejo de DDHH de la ONU se instalo la "oficina de DDHH de ONU", pero nunca pueden ocultar su naturaleza  intrigante.
					
					La RPDC rechazo inmediata y totalmente la "resolucion de DDHH", aprobada a fuerza en marzo del ano pasado en la 25a sesion del susodicho consejo, razon por la cual no reconoce nunca esa "oficina".
					
					Condenamos la instalacion de la "oficina" como otra expresion de la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de las fuerzas hostiles que se valen de las mentiras y fraudes enloquecidos por el arraigado veto a la RPDC.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas convirtieron su territorio como tundra de DDHH practicando las infames leyes anti-DDHH tales como la "ley de seguridad". A pesar de esto se ponen a la cabeza de la instalacion de "oficina de DDHH" anti-RPDC hablando ruidosamente de "DDHH" de esta, lo cual es el climax del cinismo y absurdidad.
					
					Otros paises del mundo no se atrevieron a fabricar tal "oficina". Sin embargo, las autoridades surcoreanas la instalaron a toda costa en Seul, lo cual es un imprudente acto anacronico que niega la voluntad de toda la nacion coreana aspirante a la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas y lleva a la extremidad la confrontacion Norte-Sur.
					
					Es muy claro que la "oficina de DDHH", aparato de ejecucion de la politica hostil anti-RPDC de Estados Unidos, cumplira la funcion de recoger los datos falsos inventados por los "fugitivos norcoreanos" y otros menganos y fulanos para ganar el dinero.
					
					Es ridicula la maquinacion de EE.UU. y otras fuerzas hostiles de patrocinar a las escorias humanas que mantienen su vida con las mentiras para seguir aferrandose a la campana intrigante de "DDHH" anti-RPDC.
					
					Es una vana ilusion el intento de atentar con viles medios y maneras como la instalacion de la "oficina de DDHH" a la digna RPDC con la independencia y el Songun.
					
					La RPDC frustrara con la rotunda contramedida super-intransigente tal imprudente conspiracion de "DDHH" anti-RPDC de las fuerzas hostiles.

articles.title: IRP revela tragica situacion laboral del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
IRP revela tragica situacion laboral del Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 24 de junio (ACNC) -- El Instituto de la Reunificacion de la Patria (IRP) hizo publica el dia 24 una carta blanca para revelar la peor situacion laboral de los trabajadores surcoreanos, causada por la dominacion antipopular de las autoridades surcoreanas.
					Hoy dia, en el Sur de Corea crece en forma geometrica el numero de desempleados, presentado como grave problema social, comienza la carta blanca y continua:
					
					En 2013, el numero de desocupados llegaba a mas de 3 millones 500 mil, y en 2014, a mas de 4 millones 500 mil. Y mas de 500 mil de ellos abandonaron completamente el comienzo de trabajo.
					
					El numero de subempleados se incremento de 8 millones a 10 millones.
					
					Lo mas problematico es el problema de desempleo de los jovenes.
					
					A principios de este ano, el porcentaje de desempleo de los jovenes llego a 21.8%, cifra mas aumentada que en 1997 cuando la crisis de divisas causo la bancarrota de muchas empresas y muchos desempleados. Esta cifra es mas alta que el porcentaje promedio de desempleo en los paises regionales y miembros de la Organizacion de Cooperacion Economica y Desarrollo
					
					Alcanzan a mas de 2 millones 750 mil los graduados universitarios que vagabundean en las calles por no poder obtener el empleo.
					
					Entre los jovenes surcoreanos hay muchos que abandonaron el amor, la boda, el parto, la preparacion de casa y las relaciones humanas.
					
					Sin embargo, la mandataria surcoreana envia muchos jovenes al extranjero diciendoles que pueden obtener el empleo en ultramar. 
					
					Pero, ellos sufren solo los martirios nacionales, el desprecio y la muerte tragica. 
					
					Es 37.1% la proporcion de los subempleados con el trabajo inestable cuyo plazo contratado es menos de un ano, cifra mas alta entre los principales paises capitalistas y los paises regionales.
					
					Lo mas pasmado es que existe el "moderno regimen de rango", segun el cual si los padres son subempleados, sus hijos tambien deben ser lo mismo. 
					
					La carta blanca revela que en el Sur de Corea los obreros hacen trabajos inhumanos y excesivos en un ambiente mas vulgar.
					
					Segun los datos reducidos presentados por las autoridades interesadas del Sur de Corea, en el ano pasado, en toda la extension surcoreana, el numero de los danados por la catastrofe industrial llega a mas de 90 mil 900 como promedio diario. Mas de 83 mil 200 de ellos son los danados por los accidentes y mas de 7 mil 600, por las materias toxicas.
					
					El numero de los muertos por la calamidad industrial es 2-4 veces mayores que en los paises capitalistas, con lo cual ocupa el primer lugar en el mundo.
					
					Al presentar al Sur de Corea, CNN de EE.UU. transmitio en agosto del ano pasado que el tiempo de trabajo de una semana de los obreros surcoreanos es 12 horas mas largas que el promedio tiempo laboral de los trabajadores del mundo y el promedio tiempo de sueno diario de ellos es menos de 6 horas.
					
					Asi, los obreros surcoreanos sufren mucho por el trabajo asesino, pero, reciben salario mas bajo.
					
					En el Sur de Corea donde reina la ley de selva, se comenten sin vacilacion alguna el crimen asalariado que viola y pisotea flagrantemente los derechos humanos de los trabajadores.
					
					Lo grave del caso es que los ninos, los discapacitados y las mujeres, que deben ser protegidos por la sociedad, se tratan como "mano de obra facil de explotar con salario bajo". 
					
					La ley internacional prohibe el trabajo infantil. Pero, en la sociedad surcoreana los adolescentes se someten forzosamente a los trabajos duros. 
					
					Ahora, el 74.2% de los adolescentes que se dedican a los servicios en Seul hacen el trabajo esclavo sin contrato. 
					
					Es muy horrorosa la explotacion de la mano de obra de los discapacitados. 
					
					Segun el informe publicado el ano pasado por la Organizacion de Cooperacion Economica y Desarrollo (ODCE), la tasa de participacion de las mujeres de 25-54 anos en las actividades economicas y la de su empleo es de 62.8% y 61.2%, respectivamente, cifras mas bajas de entre los paises miembros de la ODCE. 
					
					Lo mas problematico es la violacion sexual en los puestos de trabajo. 
					
					En marzo pasado la revista britanica Economist critico que la discriminacion de las mujeres es mas grave en el Sur de Corea.
					
					Ahora las masas trabajadoras surcoreanas protestan a riesgo de la vida la politica laboral antipopular de las autoridades a favor de los plutocratas financieros.
					
					Despues de la aparicion del "poder" actual, mas de 200 mil obreros surcoreanos suicidaron por la represion sindical y el alboroto de despido libre. 
					
					Los obreros, dispuestos a morir, libran hasta la huelga de brazos caidos en la altura. 
					
					Cuanto mas se intensifique la represion de las autoridades, se aumenta tanto mas la lucha de los obreros contra las politicas antipopulares. 
					
					Tales hechos muestran que el Sur de Corea es la sociedad tenebrosa y el peor infierno de derechos humanos y de democracia. 
					
					Sin embargo, los gobernantes surcoreanos censuran atrevidamente el mas ventajoso regimen laboral de la RPDC, donde se implementan las politicas populares, y la vida laboral de los trabajadores norcoreanos en ultramar, lo cual es una provocacion ridicula. 
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos deben darse clara cuenta de que la campana intrigante de "derechos humanos" anti-RPDC en confabulacion con las fuerzas extranjeras acelerara el arruinamiento de si mismos.
